title: Consecutive Numbers
markdown:
# **Consecutive Numbers**

## Find all numbers that appear at least three times consecutively.

### Table Schema
| Column | Type |
|--------|------|
| id     | INT  |
| num    | INT  |

### Example

**Input:**
```
**Logs**
+----+-----+
| id | num |
+----+-----+
| 1  | 1   |
| 2  | 1   |
| 3  | 1   |
| 4  | 2   |
| 5  | 1   |
| 6  | 2   |
| 7  | 2   |
+----+-----+
```

**Expected Output:**
```
+-----------------+
| ConsecutiveNums |
+-----------------+
| 1               |
+-----------------+
```

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Logs(id INT, num INT); INSERT INTO Logs VALUES (1,1),(2,1),(3,1),(4,2),(5,1),(6,2),(7,2);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT DISTINCT l1.num AS ConsecutiveNums FROM Logs l1, Logs l2, Logs l3 WHERE l1.id = l2.id - 1 AND l2.id = l3.id - 1 AND l1.num = l2.num AND l2.num = l3.num;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Logs(id INT, num INT); INSERT INTO Logs VALUES (1,1),(2,2),(3,1),(4,2);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT DISTINCT l1.num AS ConsecutiveNums FROM Logs l1, Logs l2, Logs l3 WHERE l1.id = l2.id - 1 AND l2.id = l3.id - 1 AND l1.num = l2.num AND l2.num = l3.num;

testCases.setupSql: CREATE TABLE Logs(id INT, num INT); INSERT INTO Logs VALUES (1,1),(2,1),(3,1),(4,2),(5,2),(6,2);
testCases.solutionSql: SELECT DISTINCT l1.num AS ConsecutiveNums FROM Logs l1, Logs l2, Logs l3 WHERE l1.id = l2.id - 1 AND l2.id = l3.id - 1 AND l1.num = l2.num AND l2.num = l3.num;
